critique: This document concerns national security. It amends a previous executive order to exempt certain elements of the Defense Mapping Agency and Joint Special Operations Command from provisions of title 5 of the United States Code, specifically Chapter 71, due to national security considerations. This suggests a prioritization of national security over certain labor or administrative regulations. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or social inclusion. The federalism aspect is neutral as it pertains to federal entities. The executive power is slightly expanded as it allows for exemptions based on national security.
